intro: Guindilia cristata, commonly known as the cristate guindilia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
